name: places/ChIJKztsXoBZwokRxR0x4fwu3ho
formattedAddress: 171 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 171 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
Samantha, at the front desk, was magnificent. Professional and polite, while also warm and even funny.

I went in for a knee surgery.
My procedure was the last of the day and there was a 2-hour delay. They didn't let me know until I was already there so I had to wait in the pre op room for over 3 hours (which on an empty stomach felt like a long time).
The staff was very accommodating though and I received excellent care during the wait.

After the surgery they brought me cookies. I asked for a piece of fruit instead, but that was not an option.
I was surprised that a clinic would offer a highly processed food, made of sugar and synthetic ingredients to someone coming out of a 24-hour fasting period. Yes, it would have raised my glucose levels, but also contributed to long-term undesired consequences on my health. Why not offer something rich in antioxidants that could actually benefit my recovery?

Overall I had a positive experience, and I would recommend this clinic. However, as a time and health-conscious patient, I wanted to share my feedback on the two areas that could be improved:
- Early communication regarding surgery delays
- Healthier post-surgery snacks

originalText.text: Wonderful neighborhood healthcare facility operated by NYU Langone.

originalText.text: Stellar top notch surgeons. Especially Dt Lew Schon.  A simply brilliant surgeon specialist. If someone suggests fusion...run to NYU Orthopedic.
